description: Number of powers of 2 in sequence obtained when phi (A000010) is repeatedly applied to n.
example: If n=164, the "iterated phi-sequence" for n is {164,80,32,16,8,4,2,1}. It includes 6 powers of 2 at the end, so a(164)=6.
mathematica: pwrs2 = NestList[2#&, 1, 15];Table[Length[Intersection[NestWhileList[EulerPhi[#]&, i, # > 1 &], pwrs2]], {i, 100}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Dec 12 2010 *)
author: _Labos Elemer_
